name: Antonio Blanca
content: Antonio Blanca Antonio Blanca Associate Professor Pennsylvania State University Theory Group I am the Dorothy Quiggle Professor in Engineering in the CSE Department at Pennsylvania State University. My research interests include randomized algorithms, Markov chain Monte Carlo, spin systems, learning, testing, and applications in statistical physics and computational biology. My research has been supported by the NSF (CAREER CCF-2143762, CISE CCF-2312709, GRFP), NIH (NIGMS R01GM146462), and the UC Berkeley Chancellor’s Fellowship. I am currently serving as the Professor in Charge of the CSE Graduate Programs.
